31 #include "PoleTides.hpp"
32 #include "CivilTime.hpp"
33 #include "MJD.hpp"
34 
35 
36 namespace gpstk
37 {
38 
39  /* Returns the effect of pole tides (meters) at the given
40  * position and epoch, in the Up-East-North (UEN) reference frame.
41  *
42  * @param[in] t Epoch to look up
43  * @param[in] p Position of interest
44  *
45  * @return a Triple with the pole tide effect, in meters and in
46  * the UEN reference frame.
47  *
48  * @throw InvalidRequest If the request can not be completed for
49  * any reason, this is thrown. The text may have additional
50  * information about the reason the request failed.
51  *
52  * @warning In order to use this method, you must have previously
53  * set the current pole displacement parameters
54  *
55  */
56  Triple PoleTides::getPoleTide( const CommonTime& t,
57  const Position& p )
58  throw(InvalidRequest)
59  {
60 
61  // We will store here the results
62  Triple res(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
63 
64  // Declare J2000 reference time: January 1st, 2000, at noon
65  const CivilTime j2000(2000, 1, 1, 12, 0, 0.0);
66 
67 
68  try
69  {
70 
71  // Get current position's latitude and longitude, in radians
72  double latitude(p.geodeticLatitude()*DEG_TO_RAD);
73  double longitude(p.longitude()*DEG_TO_RAD);
74 
75  // Compute appropriate running averages
76  // Get time difference between current epoch and
77  // J2000.0, in years
78  double timedif((MJD(t).mjd - MJD(j2000).mjd)/365.25);
79 
80  double xpbar(0.054 + timedif*0.00083);
81  double ypbar(0.357 + timedif*0.00395);
82 
83  // Now, compute m1 and m2 parameters
84  double m1(xdisp-xpbar);
85  double m2(ypbar-ydisp);
86 
87  // Now, compute some useful values
88  double sin2lat(std::sin(2.0*latitude));
89  double cos2lat(std::cos(2.0*latitude));
90  double sinlat(std::sin(latitude));
91  double sinlon(std::sin(longitude));
92  double coslon(std::cos(longitude));
93 
94  // Finally, get the pole tide values, in UEN reference
95  // frame and meters
96  res[0] = -0.033 * sin2lat * ( m1*coslon + m2*sinlon );
97  res[1] = +0.009 * sinlat * ( m1*sinlon - m2*coslon );
98  res[2] = -0.009 * cos2lat * ( m1*coslon + m2*sinlon );
99 
100  // Please be aware that the former equations take into account
101  // that the IERS pole tide equations use CO-LATITUDE instead
102  // of LATITUDE. See Wahr, 1985.
103 
104  } // End of try block
105  catch(...)
106  {
107 
108  InvalidRequest ir("Unknown error when computing pole tides.");
109  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
110 
111  }
112 
113  return res;
114 
115  } // End of method 'PoleTides::getPoleTide()'
116 
117 
118 
119  /* Method to set the pole displacement parameters
120  *
121  * @param x Pole displacement x, in arcseconds
122  * @param y Pole displacement y, in arcseconds
123  *
124  * @return This same object
125  */
126  PoleTides& PoleTides::setXY( const double& x,
127  const double& y )
128  {
129 
130  xdisp = x;
131  ydisp = y;
132 
133  return (*this);
134 
135  } // End of method 'PoleTides::setXY()'
136 
137 
138 
139 } // End of namespace gpstk
